help.title: Space Shuttle
help.text:
Start like a airplane: (as we have no ramp jet) Pilot, Tank 0, Tank 1 are set initially Tank 2 will be for comming engine to make orbit maneuvers, no need to set it now Tank 3 and 4 are emty in the beginning, they are for the engines of the OCS (Orbital Control System) You need to set them later.
Now the shuttle will be in horizontal position.
Befor take off, set the wing leveler activ and the pitch control to 23 degree. Close the doors by clicking on them. Open the payload menue and the generic autopilot menue. Open the HUD, key H.
Give throttle, and take off, be carefull with throttle - it is a rocket! Hold it in a climbing position of 23-54 degree and go to 17000 ft, stop throttle, set the Autopilot to -1 pitch hold and give throttle again. If the shuttle goes up more then 35 degree reduce throttle. Try to get a speed of 12000 kts for a 10 minute orbital flight, 22000 kts for 20 minutes. We work on getting the orbital speed of 28000 kts to reach a stable orbit position.
When reaching 145000 ft deactivate the tank and booster rockets by setting the Tank 0 and 1 to 0. You are now making a ballistic flight pattern, reaching 2200000 ft is possible.
Fill Tank 3 and 4 now to full and watch the autopilot controlling the OCS engines, manually controll is recommendet to get a stable position by only short (0.08 sec!) impulses.
Entering the athmosphere is tricky: set the autopilot to -40 degree pitch and hope for the best :) At 80000 ft the shuttle should be stable and you set the pitch to -3 degree or to +3.
Now you glide to your landing spot.
Gears, Flaps and Speed Breaks are not animated but are there in the jsb.
ILS Heading is working, glidepath is not usefull as you have a different glide path as a comercial airliner. Landing with 220-280 kt, Flaps one or two steps.
Wing and Pitch leveler with 6 extra engines working with autopilot in outer-space!
Click the little windows on top of the cockpit to activate the man for the moon :)
Click the satelit to launch it, click again to set a new one and so on, or use the trigger button for that.
Have fun and take your time to get control, it is a little bit tricky but fully working.
See the latest version on: www.github.com/HerbyW/antonov-aircrafts
